707091f-a.title: Brooklyn: Troy Ave. - Kings Hwy.
707091f-a.text:
Troy Ave., near King's Highway and westward towards the Flatlands Dutch Reformed Church, whose spire may be seen beyond the trees. Once, s brook, known as Van Mater's Skating Pond ran easterly through the Willow
trees seen in the foregroundf.
1922.
Eugene L Armbruster Collection.
707091f-a.folder: Troy Ave. & Kings Hwy., Brooklyn, NY

705262f-a.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - Avenue K
705262f-a.text:
(1)
4143-4149 Kings Eighway, east side, south of the intersection of Ave. K. and Kings Highway. A view of the Amersfort Nursery.
August 7, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle.
August 7, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

705263f-b.text:

Hubbard Place.

705264f-b.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - Avenue K
705264f-b.text:
Eings Highway, west side, at the S.W. corner of Ave. K, showing the Joseph Flemming home. (He was the village blacksmith, and he had his smithy at Flatland Turnpike and Alton Place for thirty yearsi.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
The same, from a different angle.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

705253f-b.title: Brooklyn: Kings Highway - Troy Avenue
705253f-b.text:
4419 Kings Highway, west side, 50 vards north of Troy Avenue, showing the John A. Voorhis House, the central portion of which was built in 1800; the right part was built in 1850. John Voorhis was Supervisor of the town of Flatlands and Assemblyman from Kings
County.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection 1922
2,3: Two views, at later dates.
P. L. Sperr  View 2: Auguat 7, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 3: June 27, 1940
705253f-b.folder: Kings Highway & Troy Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
